thread.title: On social media, friends pay tribute to the Lims
thread.title_full: On social media, friends pay tribute to the Lims

title: On social media, friends pay tribute to the Lims
text:
On social media, friends pay tribute to the Lims 
PETALING JAYA: He was strong on friendship and brotherhood, always cheerful and funny. 
Friends of Lim Yong Liang are just not ready to say goodbye to this “great guy”. 
“This is so devastating. Nobody saw it coming. You’ve been a really good friend to me and always have my back. No matter what kind of favour/help I need, you’ll be there to help me out. 
“Didn’t expect you to be the one who left us. You’re supposed to attend my father’s first year prayer but now I’ve to attend yours. Rest in peace, Lance Abato you’ll be missed buddy,” wrote Vinod DL on his Facebook dedication to Yong Liang. 
Yong Liang, 20, used the moniker Lance Abato on Facebook. 
On his Instagram account, a user known as crescendoremi05, said “you will always be the funny and cheerful great friend to all of us”. 
Amshah_official wrote: “I lost one of my friend. We will always remember you in our heart. We will pretend that you’re still alive beside us.” 
Martinkjoshua commented on Yong Liang’s Instagram photo: “You and your family members do not deserve to leave like this, may you and your family’s soul rest in peace bro, you may be gone but you will never be forgotten my dear friend.” 
On Ah Kok, the father’s Facebook and Instagram accounts, there were many pictures of him hiking and camping. He also frequently posted photos of his involvement in the Rukun Tetangga at his neighbourhood in USJ 2, Subang Jaya. 
“I am sad about what happened this morning. Thank you for your contribution to this community. May you RIP,” read one of the many condolence messages on Ah Kok’s Facebook page posted by user Xiu Wei. 
Another user, Alicia Lim said: “I can’t accept (the situation) but I will face it.” 
Khoo Yong Hian expressed sadness over the incident and added that the family will be missed.
